abstract_summ: RESULTS: There were 181 confirmed cases with identifiable exposure and symptom onset windows to estimate the incubation period of COVID-19.The infectious curve showed that in 73.0% of the secondary cases, their date of getting infected was before symptom onset of the first-generation cases, particularly in the last three days of the incubation period.LIMITATION: Publicly reported cases may overrepresent severe cases, the incubation period for which may differ from that of mild cases.Interestingly, incubation periods of 233 cases (11.6%) were longer than the WHO-established quarantine period (14 days).One study showed that severe COVID‐19 cases, which included more elderly patients, had longer incubation periods.

title_abstract_phrases: LIMITATION: Publicly reported cases may overrepresent severe cases, the incubation period for which may differ from that of mild cases.The cases transmitted by lunch/dinner parties could be infected first in the gastrointestinal tract through oral transmission and then infected in the respiratory system so that they had a longer incubation period.RESULTS: There were 181 confirmed cases with identifiable exposure and symptom onset windows to estimate the incubation period of COVID-19.The infectious curve showed that in 73.0% of the secondary cases, their date of getting infected was before symptom onset of the first-generation cases, particularly in the last three days of the incubation period.Interestingly, incubation periods of 233 cases (11.6%) were longer than the WHO-established quarantine period (14 days).
